channel.title: Help me out here!
channel.description: OK, so my mom want to buy me a MAC, which is gay. Everyone knows that windows rules, can you guys list me pros about windows and cons about macs, just make mac sound like shit, this way she will get me a windows laptop instead. THANKS (PS. It is a laptop, even stretch the truth a little, and dont hint(in ur comment) about me telling you to list pros only for windows in this message, she cant know... Instead i will edit tis message and show her :) )

item.title: Help me out here!
item.dc:creator: @n33bz0rpl0x `Aaron
item.description:
@n33bz0rpl0x wrote:

Mac’s are expensive, i would settle for a Linux system and upgrade it as much as you can, it’s much cheaper than a 2GB of ram mac+250gb harddrive, etc etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me out here!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Boot Camp (software)

Boot Camp Assistant is a multi boot utility included with Apple Inc.'s macOS that assists users in installing Microsoft Windows operating systems on Intel-based Macintosh computers. The utility guides users through non-destructive disk partitioning (including resizing of an existing HFS+ partition, if necessary) of their hard disk drive and installation of Windows device drivers for the Apple hardware. The utility also installs a Windows Control Panel applet for selecting the boot operating sys...

<3 Intel in Macs

Read full topic

item.title: Help me out here!
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Statik97:

OK, so my mom want to buy me a MAC, which is gay. Everyone knows that windows rules, can you guys list me pros about windows and cons about macs, just make mac sound like shit, this way she will get me a windows laptop instead. THANKS (PS. It is a laptop, even stretch the truth a little, and dont hint(in ur comment) about me telling you to list pros only for windows in this message, she cant know… Instead i will edit tis message and show her )

Windows:
Pros:
Diversity of applications
GUI frontend for everything
Most common operating system

Cons:
Virus Prone
Requires constant supervision
Proprietary software

Macs:
Pros:
Safe, secure, VERY few viruses
Looks good
Used by more “advanced” computer users

Cons:
Proprietary Hardware
Limited application equivalents to windows counterparts
Expensive

And now for the best:

Linux:
Pros:
EVERYTHING
OPen source development
FREE
So many choices, for whatver your needs are

Cons:
Open-source drivers aren’t always up to date
If an inexperienced user messes with shit, you’re fucked
Constant criticism from other windows, and mac users.

Read full topic
